did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.unittitle: Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee records
did.abstract: The collection documents the time that John Dockery served on the Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee. John Dockery worked on the committee from the 1970s into the 1980s. Most of the documents are dated in the 1970s with a few in the 1960s, 1980s and 1990s. The documents are memos, blueprints, maps and other paperwork involved in the running of the committee.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee records, Collection #C0143, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee records were originally attached to the larger Planned Community Collection currently in the Special Collections and Archives. In 2009 the papers were removed and organized into a separate collection. The old box and folder numbers for each folder are also included as part of the new arrangement.
Processed in January 2009 by Emily Martin.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Reston is a planned community in Northern Virginia. Robert E. Simon, Jr. was the founder of Reston, and he purchased the land with the proceeds from the sale of Carnegie Hall in New York City in 1961. Construction began in 1963 with the building of Lake Anne. Simon wanted Reston to be a place where individuals could remain their entire lives, thus many different types of housing were constructed. In 1968 the Reston Community Association (RCA) was created to take responsibility for community programs. John Dockery served on the Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee from the 1970s to the early 1980s. During that time the Reston Community Association was incorporated with the Reston Homeowners Association under the name Reston Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the time that John Dockery served on the Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee. John Dockery worked on the committee from the 1970s into the 1990s. Most of the documents are dated in the 1970s with a few in the 1960s, 1980s and 1990s. The documents include memos, blueprints, maps and other paperwork involved in the running of the committee.

The documents are organized into two series. The series one consists of subject files arranged in alphabetical order. Documents with the same title are then organized into chronological order. The documents all relate to the Reston Community Association Planning and Zoning Committee.

Series two consists of documents arranged in chronological order. Some of the documents titles are similar to series one while others are merely titled with the project number. All of these documents relate to planning and zoning projects in Reston.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Special Collections and Archives also holds the Planned Community Archives and other personal papers and organizational records that document Reston, Virginia, and other planned communities.

scopecontent.p: The documents include maps, planning documents, memoranda, correspondence, legal documents and other related material. There are eleven boxes with the documents organized alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Reston Area Planning Documents and Maps,

scopecontent.p: Conceptual Site Plan for Fairways Apartments near Lake Anne; Site Plan for the Spectrum Shopping Center into a mixed-use development; Block 16 owned by Boston Properties at the Town Center. The last remaining lot that has not been developed inside the current boundary of the Town Center.; Comstock Site Plan (Conceptual) for the parking garage and mixed use development for the Wiehle Metro station.
